Package com.endava.drodriguez

Class Dispatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.endava.drodriguez.Dispatcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer
    public class Dispatcher
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Observer
    Singleton class to manage Client attention. Creates a multi-threaded pool, assigning a client to an available Bank Agent and executing all the processes.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      private class  Dispatcher.AgentComparator
      Compares the Agents by the level of responsibility.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Dispatcher getInstance()

      • startExecutor

        private void startExecutor()
        Creates a new pool of Threads with a maximum capacity of 10 concurrent Threads. Records the beginning time of the Thread pool.

      • attend

        public void attend​(Client client)
        Simulates the attention of an incoming client. If the attention clients is shutdown, then starts the Thread pool and assigns the Client to a Available Agent and starts the attention process in a new Thread.
        Parameters:
        client - Incoming Client to be attended. It is added to a Blocking Queue representing the waiting line.

      • update

        public void update​(java.util.Observable o,
                   java.lang.Object arg)
        Called when the Observed object (Agents) become available. When the Agents finish the Client processing, each notify the Dispatcher that they are available, and the Dispatcher adds them again to the Agents PriorityQueue ready to attend new clients.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
        Parameters:
        o - The object observed. Represents the Agent that has finishedits process and is available to attend another client.
        arg - Any argument returned by the Observable. Default parameter. Not in use.

      • startAttention

        public void startAttention()
        Creates the Thread with Completable Future for any Clients that may be waiting in clients, if there are enough Agents available. Elsewise, attends as much clients as it may be possible. In oder words, creates the number of tasks equivalent to the minimum value between number of waiting Clients, and number of available Agents.
